Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw two different habitats, such as one on land (e.g., garden, forest) and one in water (e.g., pond, lake).
The student can draw different types of living things, like plants and animals, that can be found in each habitat.
The student can show the diversity of life by including a variety of living things in each habitat (e.g., trees, grasses, fishes, squirrels).
The student can observe and represent patterns by showing how certain plants and animals are specific to one habitat type.
The student can compare and contrast the living things in the two different habitats by showing what is common and what is unique to each habitat in their drawings.
